name: Hotel The Neighbour's Magnolia

reviews.text: Greeted by Tessa upon our arrival. Didn't spend much time at the hotel but everything went
reviews.title: Everything went very well

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: as planned. Would stay there again for sure. Had a comfortable bed and clean bathroom.
reviews.title: Great Location for Couples - Great Staff!!

reviews.text: Worth the price. Liked the place. Job well done.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel Zandbergen twelve years ago and recently I revisited it with my spouse. We are respectively 67 and 64 and reasonably fit. While the hotel has changed hands the spirit of the place continues and it remains a gem. This is a boutique hotel located smack dab between the main art museums, the ConcertBouw and Vondel Park, (also close to Leidseplein) in a really nice, safe, upscale and quiet section of Amsterdam. All the above tourist features are within easy walking distance. The # 2 Tram stops a half block outside the door and this makes your eventual travels into the centre and around the city a breeze. The second floor stairs are steep, but this is true everywhere in Amsterdam. A hotel offering an elevator is simply another kind of hotel. If you need that, go elsewhere. The hotel staff are terrific and will have all the answers you need as well as some advance tickets to events. The hotel offers a European style buffet breakfast at by most standards nominal extra cost per day. This is quite good and highly recommended. Generally the rooms are small as this is the Netherlands, but are nicely equipped and super clean. The hotel recently bought the property next door and they are converting it to more rooms. We stayed for four nights in a very large new upper floor room. The streets are quiet after ten pm and still safe to walk. Unless you really like a lot of noise and hub-bub you may regret staying at hotels located in major squares or right in the core as Amsterdam runs 24/7. The location also makes getting to the airport a breeze. Any cab can get you there in 20 minutes for 30 Euros. Stay a few nights and pay in advance for better rates. Strongly recommended for like-minded couples, weary travelers and business people.
reviews.title: Hotel Zandbergen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here as part of a group from work and enjoyed it thoroughly. The hotel was in a perfect location for the #2 tram which was so convenient. Like another review just mentioned the staff are second to none,top class and so friendly and helpful. They phoned a taxi for prices for us and then booked one for us. Also gave us all the assistance we needed on places to visit,etc. The breakfast was served till 11 which was great as we were all wrecked from travelling and walking. Good variety of food for breakfast also. Rooms clean and comfortable. Some were a bit on the small side tho. Nice pub just down on the corner which also served lovely food.
reviews.title: Great reception and very good location
Superb hotel - great hospitality
reviews.text: Just back from a 4 night stay in the Hotel Zandbergen. This is a superb hotel. We could not find fault with it. Our double room was of adequate size (bigger than some rooms we've stayed in in the UK) and spotlessly clean. It had a minibar / fridge and we requested tea making facilities which were supplied free of charge. The bathroom was also in immaculate condition.

reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel
reviews.text: The continental breakfast was more than adequate. Cereals, rolls, croissants, ham, cheese and boiled eggs were all on offer, along with tea, coffee and toast.

reviews.title: Up there with the Best
reviews.text: The staff were very hospitable and always willing to help. The manager, Henk, is a gentleman.

reviews.title: Hands down, my best hotel experience!
reviews.text: The hotel also provides free internet access in the lobby, and free wireless internet access through out the hotel. We were on the 2nd floor at the back of the hotel and still got a decent signal.

reviews.title: All a hotel should be
reviews.text: The stairs are steep, but this is the case with alot of hotels in Amsterdam given the architecture of the buildings.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very clean comfortable room, with a pleasant helpful staff, made for a pleasant stay in Amsterdam.
reviews.title: pleasant stay

reviews.text: Location of the hotel was in a very nice upscale neighborhood. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent for a short break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location in a quiet residential area. Convenient for Reiksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum.Easy walk to pick up canal boat bus service opposite Reiksmuseum. Several nice restaurants and cafes close by.Hotel staff were friendly polite and helpful. We had a twin room on the second floor @ the rear of the hotel overlooking some gardens. The room was quite small but adequate for our needs,a pity there was no tea and coffee making facilities.
reviews.title: Nice, quiet, well-situated holte;

reviews.text: Just what we were looking for: nice, quiet, clean hotel near to the museum quarter. Trams are very close and you can get to the museums and the central station off this tram line very easily. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Rooms were recently refurbished - very nice - and the corridors were repainted whilst we were there.
reviews.title: A fun weekend (or more) in Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great little hotel in a lovely quiet residential area. The tram runs literally outside the hotel, but everything seems to be mere minutes away (the museums are all about 15 mins walk from the hotel), and staff showed us how to get to places we wanted to go. I think rooms are in the middle of a refurb so can't comment on the furniture but we had a studio apartment which was lovely (felt very Amsterdam-y), with little balcony, really comfy beds and a flatscreen TV. Room was made up and cleaned every day with fresh towels etc. Staff really friendly and helpful. Recommended for anyone who wants to be a stones throw from the action but can retreat to the quiet if necessary.
reviews.title: Very good hotel, friendly and helpful staff!

reviews.text: Friendly staff and great location. Room is small but very clean, no mini-bar in the room but an honesty bar in reception. As we say in Dutch "klein maar fijn", small but very good. And the area itself is fun to explore with lots of nice shops.
reviews.title: Clean and Cozy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location for a weekend in Amsterdam. Close to vondelpark and running. Friendly staff. New and nicely styled room. We had a great stay and will be back at Hotel Zandbergen Wien visiting Amsterdam next time.
reviews.title: Great plage to stay in Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very pleased with the hotel. Friendly welcome. Small rooms but clean and clear. Correct breakfast. located in a very calm town quarter next to Vondel park and lots of transport facilities to go to town center or airport. Very helpful staff.
reviews.title: nice stay in Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel feels like home. The staff is friendly and nothing is to much to meet your demands. For us the location was good reachable by public transport and there were plenty places to eat or to have a drink in the more uptown atmosphere. The rooms are not big or modern, but everything you need to have a good night sleep is at hand. The museums are at walking distance, approx 10 minuten. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to our friends as a little gem.
reviews.title: Feels like home

reviews.text: Location was very good for sightseeing, staff was extremely friendly, supportive and helpful, the room was very fine and clean. Possibly the quietest hotel room I've ever stayed in. For me a faultless hotel, highly recommend.
reviews.title: Faultless hotel - for me
Excellent service
reviews.text: We've just finished a four-night stay at Hotel Zandbergen and had a wonderful time, mainly thanks to the outstanding service offered by the manager/owner Henk.

reviews.title: Outstanding service
reviews.text: We stayed in the apartment next door, that is run by the hotel. This suited us perfectly as it gave us a little more space and privacy, but we could still enjoy breakfast each morning at the hotel. Delicious, generous buffet breakfasts!

reviews.title: Superb hotel, excellent value for money
reviews.text: Location is great - its not in the city centre, but in a fashionable residential suburb 5-10 minutes from the centre. And its near a gorgeous park, too.

reviews.title: Excellent Family Run Hotel
reviews.text: We really appreciated Henk's recommendations - I get the feeling he really understands guests' individual needs so no two recommendations are the same.

reviews.title: Nice little hotel
reviews.text: Love it! Would stay again in a flash.

reviews.title: Too small for comfort
reviews.text: The Hotel Zandbergen is in a nice neighborhood, close to the museums. Extremely small rooms. My husband and I felt crowded in our double room. Compared to our hotels in Berlin and Paris for about the same price the room was tiny. Very narrow and steep staircase is treacherous when carrying bags. The owners and staff presented a fairly neutral attitude towards us, not very welcoming. The desk is not staffed from 10 pm to 8 am which caused some problems for us. I think I would try another hotel on my next trip to Amsterdam.

reviews.title: Good value
reviews.text: A very friendly place with terrific Internet access on a terminal just beyond the check-in desk, where no one else ever seemed to notice it so I had no problems getting on whenever I liked. The rooms here are small but clean and efficient. Warning: There's no lift and the stairs are steep, so if you may regret choosing this hotel if you have a heavy bag. The neighborhood is relatively quiet, not far from the museums but a more ambitious walk from the center of town. Still, if you're a walker (or a tram rider), this hotel is a great choice.

reviews.title: Go in full confidence. Is a 4*- hotel.
reviews.text: I stayed in Zandbergen Hotel in the mid of February 2007.

reviews.title: The perfect Amsterdam hotel!
reviews.text: Booking: I searched the internet for a reasonable deal. Some hotels I used to stay became too expensive like Golden Tulip or the experience was terrible like Eden Best Western. I found good reviews about Zandbergen Hotel and I called them by phone. I realized later that if for me was a comfortable time to call in Amsterdam was 7AM. Nevertheless, a feminine voice answered promptly. I explained what I wanted, a single room, quiet, higher floor, no smoking, no pets. And, that I would rather not put my credit card on their Internet site. To my surprise, the front desk kindly agreed. The next day, I called again and sent all the information by fax. They promptly confirmed my reservation by e-mail. So far, so good.

reviews.title: Great Hotel!
reviews.text: The airport arrival: I went directly to the Tourist Information Center in Amsterdam Airport. I asked for a shuttle bus return ticket for Zandbergen Hotel. The lady at the desk had no clue where the hotel was. I told her to call (I had the phone no.) and she answered that a local call is too expensive. (Stunning answer !). Finally, she looked on the Internet and found the exact address. Travel by minibus OK.

reviews.title: Great little place to stay in a great location
reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed at the Zandbergen at the beginning and end of a trip. I was attracted by the comments of others, and despite new ownership, I was not disappointed. In fact, I can't imagine how they could do a better job. Henk, the new owner just makes you feel that you are staying with friends. Friendly, and extremely helpful with suggestions about things to do and see in Amsterdam. He arranged airport transport, which was very quick and easy. The location is wonderful, just up the street from the Museum District, and in a very nice residential neighborhood, full of interesting restaurants, where we often felt like we were the only tourists.

reviews.title: 1st class hotel
reviews.text: Breakfasts were great, and Henk would remember your drink preferences, and prepare them for you. The rooms are are very comfortable. Bathrooms are clean, no complaints. There is no elevator, and the stairs are extremely steep, but there was always help with the bags, and it is apparently the Dutch norm.

reviews.title: Like staying with friends!
reviews.text: I don't know how else to say it, but you can't help feeling that people at the Zandbergen really care about their guests. Unless someone has a heart condition that would necessitate an elevator, I would recommend the Zandbergen to anyone I know looking for a great place. And the price is reasonable, despite the weak dollar.

reviews.title: The Best!
reviews.text: An excellent hotel, friendly, clean, staff very helpful. Situated in a quiet part of town, near to parks and museum. You can buy a ticket for the Van Gough museum form the hotel - saves you queuing!

reviews.title: Absolutely Delightful!
reviews.text: Very highly recommended

Quite small Hotel, but with excellent staff... however the rooms were quite small though, but did the work... anyway who wants to hang out in his hotel in Amsterdam! The only side mark would be the interior, it was on the border of worn out. However the staff was compensating this greatly! I cannot judge about the restaurant, as I was out every evening and had to rush out in the mornings... but the smell of the bread in the morning was superb, shame had no time to taste it!!
reviews.title: Small, but in a great setting!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I arrived by train from Paris to the Central station and easily found our way to Hotel Zandbergen via Tram 2. Opposite the Railway station you can buy a travel smart card at the GVB building for tram, bus etc. I booked this hotel upon other reviews for what appeared to be good value and location and service. We had a very friendly greeting from Tessa - and over the 4 days we had friendly service from all staff. Our room was downstairs (which were steep and narrow) but not a problem for us as I believe this is normal in the area. I don't understand why some people complain if buildings, décor is not like they have at home - that's what travelling experiences are for - to broaden your outlook on another country's way of life!
reviews.title: Excellent Service and Location!

reviews.text: We had a spacious room with garden outlook, 2 queen beds and a good bathroom with a bath.
reviews.title: Smooth staying

reviews.text: Tea, coffee etc was available at reception and sometimes I would grab a mug of hot water for my herbal tea and take it to our room. The upstairs reception is light and airy with breakfast/food tables and also space the other side of this room for using computers, reading etc. I would recommend asking Reception on any outings or sightseeing ideas as they can pre-book for you and this can save time in queues. We hired Hotel Zandbergen bikes for 24 hours and literally rode around all the canals on one day and got up the next morning for a ride around the famous Vondelpark nearby.. we had not ridden for a while and I had no pain Whatsoever!! Diary of Anne Frank, Canal Tour and Van Gough Museum are all worthwhile. Even if you arrive late afternoon, a walk in Vondelpark which is 3 mins away is a good start and a beautiful area in the city. There are bike riders everywhere so take care. We found convenience stores and ATM's just a short walk away. We had a great coffee/hot choc with the best traditional apple pie at Coffee Plaza next to a Canal, I think the address is De Clercqstraat, 27 (1053 Amsterdam). The café setting was relaxing to be indoors or outdoors. Hotel Zandbergen was undergoing some painting and carpeting during our stay and as we left they were going to carpet and paint our room, so it should be even better now! Cant thank this Hotel and staff enough for a wonderful stay which created the feeling we would love to come back again and it was a lovely experience for our first visit :) :)
reviews.title: Very satisfied

reviews.text: ps hope to add photos later
reviews.title: liked it better the first few time I stayed here

description: The cosy boutique hotel The Neighbour’s Magnolia (formerly Hotel Zandbergen) features 21 restyled modern rooms in soft pastel tones, with large beds, a desk with a brightly coloured HAY chair and a flat-screen TV. Each room has a private bathroom with shower or bath. Some rooms have a balcony or terrace overlooking the garden. We can put a private mini fridge on request in your room, as well as tea and coffee making facilities . Many additional features you can just take yourself from the colourful hallways. For our single (female) travelers , we have created a comfortable and above all safe environment. The hotel itself is in located in a typical Amsterdam listed building from the early 1900s in residential Amsterdam Oud-Zuid and is one of the few independent and privately owned hotels in Amsterdam.The homely LivingRoom with reception service is furnished and decorated with a unique combination of vintage and contemporary pieces of HAY furniture. Here guests can enjoy our continental breakfast. Complimentary tea , coffee and mineral water is waiting for you upon arrival. From the Honesty Bar in the casual setting of the LivingRoom guests can enjoy a Nespresso coffee, soft drinks, beer, wines, savoury and sweet snacks. Many excellent restaurants are located just outside the hotel on the Cornelis Schuytstraat or on the Willemsparkweg.Wi-Fi is available in the entire hotel and is free of charge. Tickets to various attractions in the area you can get at the front desk where you can also rent a bike (and a packed lunch if you like). By the way, dogs are very welcome too.The famous art-packed Museum Quarter is a 10-minute walk away and houses the Van Gogh Museum, Rijksmuseum and the Stedelijk Museum. It’s also close to the renown and exclusive shopping area of the P.C. Hooftstraat. The Amsterdam canal area is easily accessible on foot or by public transport. The tranquil Vondelpark and the Leidseplein entertainment area offer an amusing stroll.
